articles.headline: Susan Wojcicki, YouTube’s Longtime C.E.O., Says She Will Step Down
articles.snippet: One of the most prominent women in Silicon Valley, she was an early Google employee and a key member of the inner circle of the company’s founders.
articles.abstract: One of the most prominent women in Silicon Valley, she was an early Google employee and a key member of the inner circle of the company’s founders.
articles.lead_paragraph: Susan Wojcicki, YouTube’s chief executive and one of the most prominent women in Silicon Valley, said on Thursday that she was stepping down from her longtime role leading the internet’s most popular video service.

articles.headline: Fetterman Checks In to Hospital for Treatment of Clinical Depression
articles.snippet: A spokesman for the first-term senator from Pennsylvania, who had a near-fatal stroke last year, said his depression had grown severe in recent weeks, as he has worked to adjust to life in the Senate.
articles.abstract: A spokesman for the first-term senator from Pennsylvania, who had a near-fatal stroke last year, said his depression had grown severe in recent weeks, as he has worked to adjust to life in the Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator John Fetterman, Democrat of Pennsylvania, who was hospitalized last week after feeling lightheaded, checked himself in to Walter Reed National Military Medical Center on Wednesday night to receive treatment for clinical depression, his office said on Thursday.

articles.headline: Fox Stars Privately Expressed Disbelief About Election Fraud Claims. ‘Crazy Stuff.’
articles.snippet: The comments, by Tucker Carlson, Sean Hannity and others, were released as part of a defamation suit against Fox News by Dominion Voter Systems.
articles.abstract: The comments, by Tucker Carlson, Sean Hannity and others, were released as part of a defamation suit against Fox News by Dominion Voter Systems.
articles.lead_paragraph: Newly disclosed messages and testimony from some of the biggest stars and most senior executives at Fox News revealed that they privately expressed disbelief about President Donald J. Trump’s false claims that the 2020 election was stolen from him, even though the network continued to promote many of those lies on the air.
articles.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and Katie Robertson

articles.headline: Federal Officials Send Help After Ohio Derailment, but Residents’ Frustrations Persist
articles.snippet: A visit to East Palestine from the head of the E.P.A. and a White House pledge to lend more support were met with skepticism in the community.
articles.abstract: A visit to East Palestine from the head of the E.P.A. and a White House pledge to lend more support were met with skepticism in the community.
articles.lead_paragraph: EAST PALESTINE, Ohio — ​​The head of the Environmental Protection Agency traveled to this small community on Thursday with promises of aid but faced skepticism from residents outraged over what they saw as a delayed response to the toxic spill unleashed by the recent train derailment.
articles.byline: By Sophie Wodzak, Emily Cochrane and Lisa Friedman

articles.headline: Why a Strong Economy Is Making Stock Investors Jittery
articles.snippet: After stocks jumped more than 6 percent in January, the tone shifted markedly this week as a steady flow of data showed the economy continued to run hot.
articles.abstract: After stocks jumped more than 6 percent in January, the tone shifted markedly this week as a steady flow of data showed the economy continued to run hot.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s dawning on stock investors that they were wrong about the Federal Reserve.
articles.byline: By Joe Rennison and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: Why China Didn’t Invent ChatGPT
articles.snippet: The state’s hardening censorship and heavier hand have held back its tech industry; so has entrepreneurs’ reluctance to invest for the long term. It wasn’t always that way.
articles.abstract: The state’s hardening censorship and heavier hand have held back its tech industry; so has entrepreneurs’ reluctance to invest for the long term. It wasn’t always that way.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just a few years ago, China was on track to challenge United States dominance in artificial intelligence. The balance of power was tilting in China’s direction because it had abundant data, hungry entrepreneurs, skilled scientists and supportive policies. The country led the world in patent filings related to artificial intelligence.

articles.headline: A Homeless Student Received Aid for an Apartment. Then Came the Hard Part.
articles.snippet: As the housing crisis deepens in Los Angeles County, one young woman learns that searching for a place of her own is more difficult than ever.
articles.abstract: As the housing crisis deepens in Los Angeles County, one young woman learns that searching for a place of her own is more difficult than ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Many of the apartment listings were outdated or offered scant details. Sometimes the rent was a few hundred dollars higher than advertised.

articles.headline: Uproar Hits CNN as Don Lemon Is Rebuked for Comments About Women
articles.snippet: Mr. Lemon’s assertion that the presidential candidate Nikki Haley is not “in her prime” roiled the network and put a harsh spotlight on its struggling morning show.
articles.abstract: Mr. Lemon’s assertion that the presidential candidate Nikki Haley is not “in her prime” roiled the network and put a harsh spotlight on its struggling morning show.
articles.lead_paragraph: Don Lemon, the CNN morning-show anchor, faced an internal rebuke from the chairman of his own network on Friday after his on-air comments about women and aging set off an uproar inside the cable news channel.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin
